channel.title: Posts on Slawomir Slav Jasinski
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Slawomir Slav Jasinski

item.title: Email Catch: From Weekend Project to Amazon SES Alternative
item.description: High-performance SMTP service written in Go as an alternative to Amazon SES. From weekend project to production-ready tool for receiving and processing emails.

item.title: Stop Building Login Pages: How External Authorization Works
item.description: External authorization puts an independent service in front of your app. It handles login, MFA, and sessions. Your app just reads HTTP headers.

item.title: Vector Databases in AI Hype or Revolution? Benefits, Use Cases & More
item.description: Discover the power of vector databases in AI. Learn about their benefits, use cases, and how to combine them with large language models (LLMs). Understand when to use them and when to stick with traditional solutions

item.title: AI Tools vs RAG Function - Boosting AI Performance & Efficiency
item.description: Unlock the full potential of AI with AI tools and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG). Discover how these two approaches enhance AI capabilities in different ways, from real-time data to deep knowledge.

item.title: Maximize AWS Efficiency and Savings
item.description: Optimize your AWS expenses with our expert guide to cost reduction, covering waste elimination, best practices, storage optimization, and leveraging cost-saving tools.

item.title: 5 Key Strategies to Effective Team Expectation Management
item.description: Optimize your AWS expenses with our expert guide to cost reduction, covering waste elimination, best practices, storage optimization, and leveraging cost-saving tools.

item.title: AWS Hidden Gems Mastering Athena, Config, and More
item.description: Unlock AWS expertise - 5 hidden gems to elevate your Solutions Architect skills. Master data analysis, security, performance & more.

item.title: Tribal Knowledge Sharing for Business Success
item.description: Unlock the power of knowledge sharing in your business! Discover why sharing expertise is crucial and how to overcome common obstacles like knowledge silos, unclear explanations, and resistance to training. Learn simple strategies to transform individual knowledge into a collective asset

item.title: Effective Communication with Clients
item.description: Speaking to clients can be tough. Experience teaches us the art of effective communication, but it's not always a straightforward skill.

item.title: Securing Client Meetings - Essential Safety Tips
item.description: Discover essential security tips for client visits, from always logging out to using MFA, based on real experiences and amusing anecdotes.

item.title: Shifting to a cloud-native architecture
item.description: Discover how to transition to cloud-native architecture for improved scalability and innovation. Learn to avoid vendor lock-in with strategic choices in technology

item.title: Techs Ever-Changing Landscape - My Journey
item.description: I'm also celebrating over 20+ incredible years of diving, head-first, into the ever-changing world of tech. It's been an absolute rollercoaster, and I wouldn't have it any other way!

item.title: GPT vs Gemini
item.description: Compare GPT & Gemini AI models speed, conciseness vs depth & adaptability. Discover their strengths, limitations, and choose the best AI technology for your needs.

item.title: Micromanagement The Silent Productivity Killer
item.description: Avoid productivity pitfalls! Learn how micromanagement hurts your team and discover tips to create a more empowering workplace.

item.title: Consultants Are Like Avocados
item.description: Consultants Not Useless, Just Misunderstood! This lighthearted article challenges Steve Jobs' view on consultants ‚Äì they're more than just fancy charts and diagrams.

item.title: Talking about AI and ML at Onet
item.description: I’m is explaining how Ringier Axel Springer Polska and Onet are innovating with #AI and #MachineLearning - e.g. to ensure the diversity in the media.

item.title: AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate
item.description: After a decade of working with AWS, I am thrilled to share that I have earned my first professional certificate as a Solution Architect. I am both surprised and humbled by this achievement. 23T0L60C6NE41F3G ( https://aws.amazon.com/verification )

item.title: SSL Certificate
item.description: I’ve got this client which is each year asking me to renew their SSl certificate. It‚Äôs EV, so it requires a little more paperwork, and a new lady from the office was helping with the process. After three weeks of pushing scans and talking with Indians, we finally got a certificate. I replaced the old one and sent an e-mail that it‚Äôs up and running. She asked me to send her a copy - I thought - it was a good point.

item.title: NodeMcu (ESP8266) water level monitor with a voltage sensor
item.description: This subject in the theory looks very easy. Just get NodeMcu board, plug sensor from the family of sensors (HY-SRF05, HC-SR04), some kind of voltage sensor and we are good to go. But you can get couple of unexpected issues here. Let‚Äôs start from the NodeMcu unit. It‚Äôs specific.

item.title: Arduino double relay keypad lock
item.description: Learn how to build a DIY Arduino-powered keyless entry system for your garage door using a keypad and double relay. Perfect for those who often forget their remotes

item.title: USB to TTL / Serial MacOS Mojave
item.description: Got a bunch of these little f*ckers and couldn‚Äôt make them to work with my Mojave fresh installation. Previously they were working, and now they are gone. I wasn‚Äôt sure what exactly I‚Äôve got. I just run Serial Detect to identify what model do I own: Then I googled driver for MacOS Mojave. Because original website: CP210x USB to UART Bridge VCP Drivers likes to file, I made a mirror on my server.

item.title: Quote - Get out of life what you deserve
item.description: ‚ÄúSpend each day trying to be a little wiser than you were when you woke up. Day by day, and at the end of the day-if you live long enough-like most people, you will get out of life what you deserve.‚Äù ‚Äî‚ÄäCharlie Munger

item.title: USB to Serial for Mac OS X
item.description:
In this quick tutorial will show how to ‚Äútalk‚Äù quickly to Serial port on Mac OS X.

Mac OS X will automatically create a serial device, which can be found in /dev.

Start a terminal session and list all available serial (or tty) devices available.

item.title: Create Kiosk with Chrome & Touch Screens
item.description:
While ago I was working in company called Imagination. I‚Äôve done some very cool projects while I was working there, and this is history off one of them.

Challenge

We were ask to create interactive solution to show case history of the oil company, for exhibition. Something really simple and inexpensive. We made information ‚Äúkiosks‚Äù where people could browse history of the company.

item.title: Quote - Leadership
item.description: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it. Dwight D. Eisenhower
